trans-unit.source: Use a timer to submit a work item
trans-unit.target: Use a timer to submit a work item

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create a work item that runs after a timer elapses.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create a work item that runs after a timer elapses.

trans-unit.source: Use a timer to submit a work item
trans-unit.target: Use a timer to submit a work item

trans-unit.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)

trans-unit.source: Important APIs
trans-unit.target: Important APIs

trans-unit.source: Windows.UI.Core namespace
trans-unit.target: Windows.UI.Core namespace

trans-unit.source: Windows.System.Threading namespace
trans-unit.target: Windows.System.Threading namespace

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create a work item that runs after a timer elapses.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create a work item that runs after a timer elapses.

trans-unit.source: Create a single-shot timer
trans-unit.target: Create a single-shot timer

trans-unit.source: Use the [**CreateTimer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh967921) method to create a timer for the work item.
trans-unit.target: Use the [**CreateTimer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh967921) method to create a timer for the work item.

trans-unit.source: Supply a lambda that accomplishes the work, and use the *delay* parameter to specify how long the thread pool waits before it can assign the work item to an available thread.
trans-unit.target: Supply a lambda that accomplishes the work, and use the *delay* parameter to specify how long the thread pool waits before it can assign the work item to an available thread.

trans-unit.source: The delay is specified using a [**TimeSpan**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225996) structure.
trans-unit.target: The delay is specified using a [**TimeSpan**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225996) structure.

trans-unit.source: **Note** You can use [**CoreDispatcher.RunAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh750317) to access the UI and show progress from the work item.
trans-unit.target: **Note** You can use [**CoreDispatcher.RunAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh750317) to access the UI and show progress from the work item.

trans-unit.source: The following example creates a work item that runs in three minutes:
trans-unit.target: The following example creates a work item that runs in three minutes:

trans-unit.source: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]
trans-unit.target: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]

trans-unit.source: Provide a completion handler
trans-unit.target: Provide a completion handler

trans-unit.source: If needed, handle cancellation and completion of the work item with a [**TimerDestroyedHandler**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh967926).
trans-unit.target: If needed, handle cancellation and completion of the work item with a [**TimerDestroyedHandler**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh967926).

trans-unit.source: Use the [**CreateTimer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh967921) overload to supply an additional lambda.
trans-unit.target: Use the [**CreateTimer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh967921) overload to supply an additional lambda.

trans-unit.source: This runs when the timer is cancelled or when the work item completes.
trans-unit.target: This runs when the timer is cancelled or when the work item completes.

trans-unit.source: The following example creates a timer that submits the work item, and calls a method when the work item finishes or the timer is cancelled:
trans-unit.target: The following example creates a timer that submits the work item, and calls a method when the work item finishes or the timer is cancelled:

trans-unit.source: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]
trans-unit.target: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]

trans-unit.source: Cancel the timer
trans-unit.target: Cancel the timer

trans-unit.source: If the timer is still counting down, but the work item is no longer needed, call [**Cancel**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR230588).
trans-unit.target: If the timer is still counting down, but the work item is no longer needed, call [**Cancel**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR230588).

trans-unit.source: The timer is cancelled and the work item won't be submitted to the thread pool.
trans-unit.target: The timer is cancelled and the work item won't be submitted to the thread pool.

trans-unit.source: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]
trans-unit.target: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]

trans-unit.source: Remarks
trans-unit.target: Remarks

trans-unit.source: Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps can't use **Thread.Sleep** because it can block the UI thread.
trans-unit.target: Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps can't use **Thread.Sleep** because it can block the UI thread.

trans-unit.source: You can use a [**ThreadPoolTimer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR230587) to create a work item instead, and this will delay the task accomplished by the work item without blocking the UI thread.
trans-unit.target: You can use a [**ThreadPoolTimer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR230587) to create a work item instead, and this will delay the task accomplished by the work item without blocking the UI thread.

trans-unit.source: See the [thread pool sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=255387) for a complete code sample that demonstrates work items, timer work items, and periodic work items.
trans-unit.target: See the [thread pool sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=255387) for a complete code sample that demonstrates work items, timer work items, and periodic work items.

trans-unit.source: The code sample was originally written for Windows 8.1 but the code can be re-used in Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: The code sample was originally written for Windows 8.1 but the code can be re-used in Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For information about repeating timers, see [Create a periodic work item](create-a-periodic-work-item.md).
trans-unit.target: For information about repeating timers, see [Create a periodic work item](create-a-periodic-work-item.md).
